page.title: 02OUTSIDE COVERACK
page.content: Being part of the Lizard platform the land above and behind the village is generally flat, with gentle rolling slopes and open valleys. The area is criss-crossed by a network of very narrow, unclassified roads, in places only wide enough for one vehicle. The exceptions to this are the Helston/St. Keverne road and its branch off to Coverack, which are B class roads. Except for the village of Coverack habitation is sparse and scattered, with small hamlets and isolated farmhouses. With the introduction of modern technology on the farms and the consequent decrease in the number of form workers many of the older houses and farm buildings which, in the past were part of the agricultural scene, have been modernised and converted for use as homes for people outside the farming community
